chatgpt-config.title: chatgpt-config
chatgpt.promptPrefix.addTests.default: Implement tests for the following code
chatgpt.promptPrefix.addTests.descriptio: The prompt prefix used for adding tests for the selected code
chatgpt.promptPrefix.addTests-enabled.de: Enable the prompt prefix used for adding tests for the selected code in the context menu
chatgpt.promptPrefix.findBugs.default: Find problems with the following code
chatgpt.promptPrefix.findBugs.descriptio: The prompt prefix used for finding problems for the selected code
chatgpt.promptPrefix.findBugs-enabled.de: Enable the prompt prefix used for finding problems for the selected code in the context menu
chatgpt.promptPrefix.optimize.descriptio: The prompt prefix used for optimizing the selected code
chatgpt.promptPrefix.optimize-enabled.de: Enable the prompt prefix used for optimizing the selected code in the context menu
chatgpt.promptPrefix.explain.description: The prompt prefix used for explaining the selected code
chatgpt.promptPrefix.explain-enabled.des: Enable the prompt prefix used for explaining the selected code in the context menu
chatgpt.promptPrefix.addComments.default: Add comments for the following code
chatgpt.promptPrefix.addComments.descrip: The prompt prefix used for adding comments for the selected code
chatgpt.promptPrefix.addComments-enabled: Enable the prompt prefix used for adding comments for the selected code in the context menu
chatgpt.promptPrefix.completeCode.descri: The prompt prefix used for completing the selected code
chatgpt.promptPrefix.completeCode-enable: Enable the prompt prefix used for completing the selected code in the context menu
chatgpt.promptPrefix.customPrompt1.descr: Your custom prompt. It's disabled by default, please set to a custom prompt and enable it if you prefer using customized prompt
chatgpt.promptPrefix.customPrompt1-enabl: Enable the prompt prefix used for your custom prompt. The default value is empty, if you enable this item make sure to set this `chatgpt.promptPrefix.customPrompt1`
chatgpt.promptPrefix.customPrompt2.descr: Your custom prompt. It's disabled by default, please set to a custom prompt and enable it if you prefer using customized prompt
chatgpt.promptPrefix.customPrompt2-enabl: Enable the prompt prefix used for your custom prompt. The default value is empty, if you enable this item make sure to set this `chatgpt.promptPrefix.customPrompt2`
chatgpt.promptPrefix.adhoc-enabled.descr: Enable the prompt prefix used for adhoc command for the selected code in the context menu
chatgpt.gpt.apiKey.markdownDescription:
OpenAI API key. [Get your API Key from OpenAI](https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys). 

**Please enable OpenAI API Key method to use this setting.**
chatgpt.gpt.apiBaseUrl.markdownDescripti: Optional override for the OpenAI API base URL. If you customize it, please make sure you have the same format. e.g. starts with `https://` without a trailing slash. The completions endpoint suffix is added internally, e.g. for reference: `${apiBaseUrl}/v1/completions`
chatgpt.gpt.organization.markdownDescrip:
OpenAI Organization ID. [Documentation](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/requesting-organization). 

**Please enable OpenAI API Key method to use this setting.**
chatgpt.gpt.model.markdownDescription:
OpenAI models to use for your prompts. [Documentation](https://platform.openai.com/docs/models/models). 

**If you face 400 Bad Request please make sure you are using the right model for your integration method.**
chatgpt.gpt.model.gpt4MarkdownEnumDescri:
ChatGPT Plus subscription GPT-4 model that's used in chat.openai.com. This requires a subscription on OpenAI side, please make sure you are eligible to use this model. 

**More capable than any GPT-3.5 model, able to do more complex tasks, and optimized for chat. Available to ChatGPT Plus users**
chatgpt.gpt.model.gpt40613MarkdownEnumDe: Snapshot of gpt-4 from June 13th 2023 with function calling data. Unlike gpt-4, this model will not receive updates, and will be deprecated 3 months after a new version is released.
chatgpt.gpt.model.gpt432kMarkdownEnumDes: Same capabilities as the base gpt-4 mode but with 4x the context length. Will be updated with our latest model iteration.
chatgpt.gpt.model.gpt432k0613MarkdownEnu: Snapshot of gpt-4-32 from June 13th 2023. Unlike gpt-4-32k, this model will not receive updates, and will be deprecated 3 months after a new version is released.
chatgpt.gpt.model.gpt35turboMarkdownEnum: Snapshot of gpt-3.5-turbo from June 13th 2023 with function calling data. Unlike gpt-3.5-turbo, this model will not receive updates, and will be deprecated 3 months after a new version is released
chatgpt.gpt.model.gpt35turbo16kMarkdownE: Same capabilities as the standard gpt-3.5-turbo model but with 4 times the context.
chatgpt.gpt.model.gpt35turbo0613Markdown: Snapshot of `gpt-3.5-turbo` from March 1st 2023. Unlike gpt-3.5-turbo, this model will not receive updates, and will only be supported for a three month period ending on June 1st 2023.
chatgpt.gpt.model.gpt35turbo16k0613Markd: Snapshot of gpt-3.5-turbo-16k from June 13th 2023. Unlike gpt-3.5-turbo-16k, this model will not receive updates, and will be deprecated 3 months after a new version is released.
chatgpt.gpt.customModel.markdownDescript:
OpenAI other models to use for your prompts. [Documentation](https://platform.openai.com/docs/models/models). 

**If you face 400 Bad Request please make sure you are using the right model for your apikey.**
chatgpt.gpt.maxTokens.markdownDescriptio:
The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion. 

The token count of your prompt plus max_tokens cannot exceed the model's context length. Most models have a context length of 2048 tokens (except for the newest models, which support 4096). [Documentation](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/completions/create#completions/create-max_tokens) 

**Please enable OpenAI API Key method to use this setting.**
chatgpt.gpt.temperature.markdownDescript:
What sampling temperature to use. Higher values means the model will take more risks. Try 0.9 for more creative applications, and 0 (argmax sampling) for ones with a well-defined answer.

It is recommended altering this or top_p but not both. [Documentation](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/completions/create#completions/create-temperature) 

**Please enable OpenAI API Key method to use this setting.**
chatgpt.gpt.top_p.markdownDescription:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered. 

It is recommended altering this or temperature but not both. [Documentation](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/completions/create#completions/create-top_p) 

**Please enable OpenAI API Key method to use this setting.**
chatgpt.gpt.systemMessage: You are ChatGPT helping the User with coding. You are intelligent, helpful and an expert developer, who always gives the correct answer and only does what instructed. You always answer truthfully and don't make things up. (When responding to the following prompt, please make sure to properly style your response using Github Flavored Markdown. Use markdown syntax for things like headings, lists, colored text, code blocks, highlights etc. Make sure not to mention markdown or styling in your actual response.)
chatgpt.response.subscribeToResponse.des: Choose whether you'd like to receive a notification when ChatGPT bot responds to your query.
chatgpt.response.autoScroll.description: Whenever there is a new question or response added to the conversation window, extension will automatically scroll to the bottom. You can change that behavior by disabling this setting.
chatgpt.pageMessage.customCommand1.input: Add prefix to your adhoc command
Prefix your code with your custom prompt1
chatgpt.pageMessage.customCommand2.input: Add prefix to your adhoc command
Prefix your code with your custom prompt2
chatgpt.pageMessage.adhocCommand.inputBo: Add prefix to your adhoc command
Prefix your code with your custom prompt.
chatgpt.pageMessage.noApiKey.message: Please add your API Key to use OpenAI official APIs. Storing the API Key in Settings is discouraged due to security reasons, though you can still opt-in to use it to persist it in settings. Instead you can also temporarily set the API Key one-time: You will need to re-enter after restarting the vs-code.
chatgpt.pageMessage.noApiKey.inputBox.ti: Store OpenAI API Key in session
chatgpt.pageMessage.noApiKey.inputBox.pr: Please enter your OpenAI API Key to store in your session only. This option won't persist the token on your settings.json file. You may need to re-enter after restarting your VS-Code
chatgpt.pageMessage.updateApiKey.inputBo: Since this plug-in can store api keys in both configuration and global state, when there are api keys in both, the api key in the global state will be updated first. When the key is stored in the configuration, the key in the configuration will be updated. When the key is stored in the global configuration, the key in the global configuration will be updated.
chatgpt.pageMessage.inprogress.message: AI is still thinking... Please wait for it to finish
chatgpt.pageMessage.dontComplete.message: It looks like ChatGPT didn't complete their answer for your coding question. You can ask it to continue and combine the answers.
chatgpt.pageMessage.maxToken.error.messa: An error occured. If this is due to max_token you could try `ChatGPT: Clear Conversation` command and retry sending your prompt.
chatgpt.pageMessage.400.error.message: your model: {model} may be incompatible or one of your parameters is unknown. Reset your settings to default. (HTTP 400 Bad Request)
chatgpt.pageMessage.401.error.message:
If you stored your API key in settings.json, make sure it is accurate. 
If you stored API key in session, 
 you can reset it with “ChatGPT: Reset session” command.
(HTTP 401 Unauthorized) Potential reasons: 
- 1.Invalid Authentication
- 2.Incorrect API key provided.
- 3.Incorrect Organization provided. 
 See https: //platform.openai.com/docs/guides/error-codes for more details.
chatgpt.pageMessage.403.error.message: Your token has expired. Please try authenticating again. (HTTP 403 Forbidden)
chatgpt.pageMessage.404.error.message: your model: {model} may be incompatible or you may have exhausted your ChatGPT subscription allowance. (HTTP 404 Not Found)
chatgpt.pageMessage.429.error.message:
Too many requests try again later. (HTTP 429 Too Many Requests) Potential reasons: 
 1. You exceeded your current quota, please check your plan and billing details
 2. You are sending requests too quickly 
 3. The engine is currently overloaded, please try again later. 
 See https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/error-codes for more details.
chatgpt.pageMessage.500.error.message:
The server had an error while processing your request, please try again. (HTTP 500 Internal Server Error)
 See https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/error-codes for more details.
chatgpt.webview.feature1: Access to your ChatGPT conversation history
chatgpt.webview.feature2: Improve your code, add tests & find bugs
chatgpt.webview.feature3: Copy or create new files automatically
chatgpt.webview.feature4: Syntax highlighting with auto language detection
chatgpt.webview.insertButtonTitle: Insert the below code to the current file
chatgpt.webview.newTabButtonTitle: Create a new file with the below code
